categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been merged into the elizaOS/eliza repository, focusing on plugin fixes, documentation improvements, and codebase enhancements.

Plugin fixes include PR #4108 by wtfsayo that addresses Twitter plugin post generation issues and applies linter fixes, PR #4106 by 0xbbjoker that fixes the Telegram plugin, and PR #4118 by wtfsayo that improves how the Groq plugin handles retries gracefully.

Code improvements include PR #4112 by wtfsayo that adds a monorepo command to the CLI, and PR #4110 also by wtfsayo that enhances component handling to prevent unnecessary fetching when components aren't required or mounted.

Documentation updates were made in PR #4114 by madjin to update the docs, and PR #4116 by 0xbryer to fix a typo in Thai text for a file path.
A new monorepo command has been added to the CLI, enhancing the project's development workflow.

Several bugfixes have been implemented, including resolving duplicate tweet errors (Twitter error 187), improving Twitter plugin post generation, enhancing Groq plugin retry handling, and fixing issues with the Telegram plugin.
Other improvements include better component handling to optimize fetching operations and updated documentation.

categories.title: Recent Issues in ElizaOS GitHub Repository

content.text:
Several issues have been reported in the ElizaOS GitHub repository:

1. Installation Dependency Error (#4109): Users are experiencing installation failures due to missing dependency @elizaos/plugin-sql@^0.25.

2. Creation Error (#4107): When using 'npx elizaos create', users encounter an error message indicating that 'agents already exists'.

3. Account Blocking Feature Request (#4117): A user is asking how to block and ban interactions with specific accounts in the system.

4. Twitter Plugin Issues (#4115): The Twitter plugin is creating duplicate memories when mentions occur, and there are problems with null post interval configuration.

5. CLI Improvement Suggestion (#4113): A feature request has been made to improve the CLI tool instructions for better user experience.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed consistent activity over a two-day period. From March 29-30, 2025, there were 5 new pull requests (all merged) and 3 new issues, with 7 active contributors participating. The following day (March 30-31, 2025) saw 3 new pull requests (2 merged), 3 new issues, and an increase to 9 active contributors. Overall, the project maintained steady development momentum with growing contributor engagement.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.
